div.head: CHAP. VIII.
Gods glory is magnified by his workes, and by his loue to man.
div.ab: [To the chiefe Musicion vpon Gittith, a Psalme of Dauid.] O Lord our Lord, how excellent is thy name in all the earth! who hast set thy glory aboue the heauens.
Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast thou ordained strength, because of thine enemies, that thou mightest still the enemie and the auenger. Mat.21. 16. , Heb. founded.
What is man, that thou art mindfull of him? and the sonne of man, that thou visitest him? Iob 7.17. psal.144.3. Heb. 2.6.
For thou hast made him a little lower then the Angels; and hast crowned him with glory and honour.
Thou madest him to haue dominion ouer the workes of thy hands; thou hast put all things vnder his feete. 1.Cor.15. 27.
All sheepe and oxen, yea and the beasts of the field. Heb. flocks and oxen, all of them.
The foule of the aire, and the fish of the sea, and whatsoeuer passeth through the paths of the seas.
O Lord our Lord, how excellent is thy name in all the earth!
